hero.title: Campus Connect
hero.subtitle: A student-centered mobile application designed to facilitate university life and create social connections on the Sorbonne Jussieu campus.

overview.label: Overview
overview.title: A comprehensive academic project
overview.description: Campus Connect is a fictional project created as part of a UX/UI Design course. The application doesn't actually exist - we only created the mockups, protocols, and research documents to simulate a complete UX process. The goal was to imagine an application that would facilitate student life by centralizing campus events, enabling users to create and join outings, and fostering connections between students.

research.label: Research
research.title: Understanding real student needs
research.intro: As part of this academic project, we conducted interviews with 3-4 students to understand their needs. We also put ourselves in students' shoes to imagine typical frustrations and expectations regarding social life and event discovery on campus.

items.title: Qualitative interviews
items.description: 3-4 semi-structured interviews with a neutral protocol to avoid bias. Open-ended questions focused on habits, frustrations, and needs related to student social life.

items.title: Role-playing
items.description: Not having time for an in-depth observation phase in a course setting, we put ourselves in students' shoes and chose a theme we knew well.

items.title: Analysis and synthesis
items.description: Grouping insights, identifying recurring patterns, creating detailed personas to guide the design.

design.label: Prototypes
design.title: From research to interactive prototype
design.intro: Armed with research insights, we designed an intuitive interface that directly addresses identified needs: event discovery, simplified creation, social connections, and personalization.

testing.label: Testing
testing.title: Validation with users
testing.intro: The testing phase was structured with rigorous protocols to validate our design hypotheses and identify improvement opportunities. We created comprehensive templates to document every aspect of testing.

items.title: Interview protocol
items.description: Open and neutral questions to avoid bias, conversation guide for semi-structured interviews with students.

items.title: User testing protocol
items.description: Clear objectives, hypotheses to validate, test scenarios, success metrics, and definition of representative user panel.

items.title: Post-test questionnaire
items.description: Quantitative and qualitative questions to measure satisfaction and gather detailed feedback from testers.
